title: Plantar Fasciitis Treatment Protocol
content: Plantar fasciitis involves inflammation of the thick band of tissue connecting the heel to the toes. Management includes rest, ice, stretching exercises, proper footwear with arch support, and night splints. Most cases resolve within 6-12 months with conservative treatment. Recalcitrant cases may benefit from corticosteroid injections, extracorporeal shock wave therapy, or rarely, surgical intervention.
